GR14vaimp__u:2107: [*212] Beginning with 5.1.149.1 there are no accent marks in the text until the third to last word of 5.1.149.4,
GR14vaimp__u:2108: where 'ham has a svarita mark. At this point the accents resume with an udātta over mām,
GR14vaimp__u:2109: the last word of this verse.
GR14vaimp__u:2111: [*214] After oṃ, beginning with the word namaḥ,
GR14vaimp__u:2112: there is a quote from the Āśvalāyana-Śrauta-Sūtra, AŚ 1.2.1, (p. 14-15)
GR14vaimp__u:2113: which continues until VMP 5.1.149.9 as indicated.
GR14vaimp__u:2116: [*217] The AŚ here gives amum iti svan nāmādiśeta.
GR14vaimp__u:2117: [*218] This verse is not in AŚ 1.2.1. The accent marks disappear again here with this verse and resume toward the end of text 5.1.149.8.
GR14vaimp__u:2125: [*222] Accent marks resume here with a svarita over the tu in santu.
GR14vaimp__u:2126: [*223] AŚ here inserts the word iti after maśīya which marks the end of AŚ 1.2.1.
GR14vaimp__u:2127: [*224] Beginning with the words tad adya in VMP 5.1.149.8 and ending here with the word juṣadhvaṃ a complete verse from RV 10.53.4 is quoted. In the VMP text,
GR14vaimp__u:2128: the verse is divided between two sections. The third line of this verse,
GR14vaimp__u:2130: is the first line of section 150,
GR14vaimp__u:2131: however the numbering has been adjusted so that the complete verse is at the end of section 149. AŚ 1.2.1 includes only a pratīka from RV 10.53.4,
GR14vaimp__u:2132: however VMP includes the entire RV verse.
GR14vaimp__u:2135: 5.1.150.3 pra vo vājā abhidyavo haviṣmanto ghṛtācyā devāṃ jigāti sumnay... [*226] om[*227]

GR14vaimp__u:2140: 5.1.150.6 sa naḥ pṛthuś śravāyyam acchā deva vivāsasi
GR14vaimp__u:2142: [*225] All accent marks disappear again from this point forward and resume at 5.1.152.5 with the word agne.
GR14vaimp__u:2145: The VMP here begins a pattern of dropping the last vowel (and any consonant that follows it)
GR14vaimp__u:2146: from the last word in an RV quote and adding om at the end. This is seen to continue through 5.1.152.4.

GR14vaimp__u:2188: [*246] Beginning with this verse and ending with verse 5.1.154.1,
GR14vaimp__u:2190: is a set of pratīkas which are found in TS 2.5.9.1-4. The complete verse is as follows (I have underlined the Sanskrit and English that appears in the VMP text)
GR14vaimp__u:2191: : agne mahāṅ asīty āha mahān hy eṣa yad agnir brāhmaṇety āha brāhmaṇo hy eṣa bhāratety
GR14vaimp__u:2192: āhaiṣa hi devebhyo havyaṃ bharati deveddha ity āha devā hy etam aindhate manviddha
GR14vaimp__u:2193: ity āha manur hy etam uttaro devebhya aindharṣi-ṣṭuta ity āharṣayo hy etam astuvan
GR14vaimp__u:2195: viprā hy ete yac chuśruvāṃso brahma-saṃśita ity āha brahma-saṃśito hy eṣa ghṛtahavana
GR14vaimp__u:2196: ity āha ghṛtāhutir hy asya priyatamā praṇīr yajñānām ity āha praṇīr hy eṣa yajñānāṃ
GR14vaimp__u:2197: rathīr adhvarāṇām ity āhaiṣa hi deva-ratho 'tūrto hotety āha na hy etaṃ kaścana (2)
GR14vaimp__u:2198: tarati tūrṇir havya-vāḍ ity āha sarvaṃ hy eṣa taraty āspātraṃ juhūr devānām ity āha
GR14vaimp__u:2199: juhūr hy eṣa devānāṃ camaso deva-pāna ity aha camaso hy eṣa deva-pāno 'rāṃ ivāgne
GR14vaimp__u:2200: nemir devāṃs tvaṃ paribhūr asīty āha devān hy eṣa paribhūr yad brūyād ā vaha devān
GR14vaimp__u:2202: janayed ā vaha devān yajamānāyety āha yajamānam evaitena vardhayati... /
GR14vaimp__u:2208: for he is a Brahman. `O Bhārata',
GR14vaimp__u:2210: for he bears the sacrifice to the gods. `Kindled by the gods',
GR14vaimp__u:2212: for the gods kindled him. `Kindled by Manu',
GR14vaimp__u:2214: for Manu kindled him after the gods. `Praised by the Ṛṣis',
GR14vaimp__u:2216: for the Ṛṣis praised him. `Rejoiced in by sages',
GR14vaimp__u:2218: for learned people are sages. `Celebrated by the poets',
GR14vaimp__u:2220: for learned people are the poets. `Quickened by the holy power (Brahman)
GR14vaimp__u:2221: ', he says, for he is quickened by the holy power (Brahman)
GR14vaimp__u:2224: for ghee is his dearest offering. `Leader of the sacrifices',
GR14vaimp__u:2226: for he is the leader of the sacrifices. `Charioteer of the rites',
GR14vaimp__u:2228: for he is the chariot of the gods. `The Hotṛ unsurpassed',
GR14vaimp__u:2233: for he surpasses all. `The mouth dish,
GR14vaimp__u:2236: for he is the ladle of the gods. `The bowl from which the gods drink',
GR14vaimp__u:2238: for he is the bowl from which the gods drink. `O Agni,
GR14vaimp__u:2242: for he surrounds the gods. If he were to say,
GR14vaimp__u:2243: `Bring hither the gods to the pious sacrificer',
GR14vaimp__u:2244: he would produce an enemy for him. `Bring hither the gods to the sacrificer',
GR14vaimp__u:2245: he says; verily with that he makes the sacrificer to grow great.“
GR14vaimp__u:2246: [*247] This verse is in parentheses in the Sanskrit text.

GR14vaimp__u:4117: [*409] VMP divides this verse making the second line the first line of chapter 26. The numbering is adjusted so that the complete verse comes at the end of chapter 25.
GR14vaimp__u:4118: 6.26.1 jātavedase sunavāma somam arātīyato ni dahāti[*410] vedaḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4119: sa naḥ parṣad ati durgāṇi viśvā nāveva sindhuṃ duritāty agni svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4120: 6.26.2 tām agni-varṇāṃ tapasā jvalantīṃ vairocanīṃ karma-phaleṣu juṣṭām

GR14vaimp__u:4124: pūś ca pṛthvī bahulā na urvī bhavā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yos svāhā

GR14vaimp__u:4130: sa naḥ parṣad ati durgāṇi viśvā kṣāmad devo ati duritāty agnis svāhā

GR14vaimp__u:4134: [*411] In RVKh the phrase sutarasi tarase namas appears twice in the verse,
GR14vaimp__u:4135: whereas VMP only gives it once.

GR14vaimp__u:4919: 7.2.1.3 [1.3] jyotir vā pāramātmikaṃ sārvaṃ viśva-bhavaṃ bhavāya prabhūtaṃ prāhiṇvan[*741] paramparāya su-kṛtaṃ kṛtāya tasmai varāya īśiṣe svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4920: 7.2.1.4 [1.4] īśo yasmād vitataṃ vitatya kaṃ kaṃ dhṛtaṃ kāma-huto juhoti
GR14vaimp__u:4921: kakudaṃ kakuc chitvā bhūyaḥ parāya svāhā

GR14vaimp__u:4927: 7.2.2.1 [1.6] yo brahma-śabdaḥ praṇavaḥ pradhānaś śabdaś śabdāntarātmā nityo viyattaḥ prataran prakāmam
GR14vaimp__u:4928: prājāpatyaṃ prataraṃ prakurvan bhūyo bhūtyai acaraṃ carāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4929: 7.2.2.2 [1.7] yo vā tri-mūrtiḥ paramaḥ paraś ca tri-guṇaṃ juṣāṇas sakalaṃ vidatte
GR14vaimp__u:4930: tris-tris tri-dhātmā tri-dhā tri-dhā vā vidadhe samastaṃ tri-dhā tri-rūpaṃ sakalaṃ-dharāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4931: 7.2.2.3 [1.8] yad vā kṛtam amṛtaṃ carāṇāṃ yat sarva-niṣṭham ajaraṃ samastam
GR14vaimp__u:4932: yat paśyamānam ātmābhijuṣāṇam antas suṣuptyān[*742]abhigamyamānāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4933: 7.2.2.4 [1.9] kaḥ[*743] kośam aṅge kuśalaṃ vidhāya sākṛtaṃ kṛṇvate 'gra idaṃ sukāntam
GR14vaimp__u:4935: 7.2.2.5 [1.10] yam yajñair munayo juṣanti yaṃ devāḥ paramaṃ pavitraṃ bhaviṣyanty ārtiṣu praṇatāḥ pradhānāḥ ya(g)
GR14vaimp__u:4936: ṃ sūrayo japanto yoginas sūkṣmais supradarśanaiḥ paśyantīśvarāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4941: 7.2.3.1 [2.1] yo vā gaviṣṭhaḥ paramaḥ pradhānaḥ padaṃ vā yasya satvam āsīt

GR14vaimp__u:4943: 7.2.3.2 [2.2] yo vā vāyur dvi-guṇo 'ntarātmā sarveṣām antaś caratīha viṣṇo
GR14vaimp__u:4944: sa tvaṃ devān manuṣyān mṛtān parisaṃjīvase svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4945: 7.2.3.3 [2.3] tvam agne tri-guṇo variṣṭhaḥ paraṃ brahma paraṃ jyotiḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4946: sarveṣāṃ tvaṃ pālanāya hutam amṛtaṃ vahiṣyaṣe svāhā

GR14vaimp__u:4950: pañcabhis sva-guṇaiḥ prasannais sarvāṇi mān dhārayiṣyasi svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4952: 7.2.4.1 [2.6] manas tvaṃ bhūtvā prataran prado 'gre tvatto bhūtaṃ saṃbhāvayiṣyasi sarveṣāṃ kāyānām arham arhate svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4953: 7.2.4.2 [2.7] tvaṃ buddhir bhūtānām antarātmā puṇyavatāṃ puṇyeṣu sajjamānaḥ tvaṃ buddhyā vicinvamānaḥ puṇya-rūpāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4955: kurvann ātmīyam amito dhunoti dhuraṃ vahiṣyase svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4956: 7.2.4.4 [2.9] yasya vā bhayād bhagavān uttasthe svayaṃ sūryas satyaṃ kālaṃ vahamānaḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4957: yasmāt teja ātmiyaṃ kṛtvā sarvān asmān pālayiṣyasi svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4958: 7.2.4.5 [2.10] yaṃ tvāṃ sarvaṃ pālanāyābhibhūtaṃ devās sarve paśye
GR14vaimp__u:4959: vicaranti te devās tvam eva sarve māyā māyaiṣā te svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4961: 7.2.5.1 [3.1] yas tvaṃ bhūtvā parjanyo bibheti randhre prajābhir
GR14vaimp__u:4962: ākṛṣyamāṇaḥ satyaṃ kālaṃ vratena pālayan hlādayiṣyase svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4963: 7.2.5.2 [3.2] kāmo bhūtvā prajānām antarā sthitas sarvā lokān hlādayañ jīvamānaḥ sandarpaṇāya haraye varāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4964: 7.2.5.3 [3.3] aṅgād aṅgād anuprāviśat sarvān lokān saṃrakṣaṇāya
GR14vaimp__u:4965: yo vā vasan devo mātariśvā sa yo 'smākaṃ bhūtyai bhūtaye svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4969: 7.2.5.5 [3.5] yo vā daśātmā upari spṛśan vā devānāṃ jyotir jyotiṣām
GR14vaimp__u:4970: uttaraḥ svayaṃ vā spṛśan jyotir jyotiṣe svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4972: 7.2.6.1 [3.6] yo brahmā brahma-vidām ātmā syād ātma-cakṣuṣām
GR14vaimp__u:4974: 7.2.6.2 [3.7] sārasvato vā eṣa devo 'yaṃ na vā hayaḥ pāramātmikaḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4976: 7.2.6.3 [3.8] yo vā paraṃ jyotiḥ paraṃ sandadhānaḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4978: 7.2.6.4 [3.9] yo doṣaś caturaś caturthaś caturaḥ padārthān
GR14vaimp__u:4979: sarvaṃ lokasya sandadhānas sate satvam ādadhānāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4981: ādadhānaḥ yaṃ brahma brahma-guptaye paraṃparāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4983: 7.2.7.1 [4.1] vāko vā anuvāko vākaṃ vākaṃ saṃjuṣamāṇaḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4984: devas sa svaṃ sva-guptaye svayaṃ jyotiṣe jyotiṣe svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4985: 7.2.7.2 [4.2] dvāv etau pakṣī acaraṃ carantau nādhuraṃ vyadhunīte
GR14vaimp__u:4987: 7.2.7.3 [4.3] yo vā āyuḥ paramātmānaṃ[*746] mīḍhuṣaḥ pāraṃparyāt paraḥ parāyaṇaḥ paro lokānāṃ paramā dadhānaḥ parataḥ parāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4988: 7.2.7.4 [4.4] yo vā tejas tejasāṃ tejas teja ādadhānaḥ
GR14vaimp__u:4989: satyas tejas tejasāṃ tejas tejas tejase svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4990: 7.2.7.5 [4.5] saha saṃpāyās tvam āśiṣam āśīr bhūtābhūtam

GR14vaimp__u:4995: saṃyogaṃ sandadhānaḥ puṇyaḥ puṇyānāṃ puṇyāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4996: 7.2.8.2 [4.7] sahasraṃ vā yasyaiva vitānam ādadhānas sahasraṃ vā
GR14vaimp__u:4997: āsiṣas sāsikāḥ sahasraṃ yasya vai sāsikās sahasraṃ sahasrāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:4998: 7.2.8.3 [4.8] svātigā guptayo guptis satyaṃ satyānāṃ sātvaṃ padam
GR14vaimp__u:4999: tat satvaṃ satvam āsīt sātvaṃ sātvaṃ vai sātvam ādadhānāya svāhā

GR14vaimp__u:5005: 7.2.9.1 [5.1] satyas satvaṃ puṇyam āsīt puṇyo vā daivikam satyaṃ
GR14vaimp__u:5006: satvam ārṣaṃ satyaṃ satvaṃ sat-pathāya svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:5007: 7.2.9.2 [5.2] satyo jyotis satvaṃ prāṇās satvādhārās satva-saṃdhānaḥ
GR14vaimp__u:5008: satyas satvaṃ prakāśaṃ jyotir jyotiṣe svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:5009: 7.2.9.3 [5.3] kāmīm umām īśiṣam īśiṣa satyam īśiṣam īśiṣāṇām tat satyaṃ satya-rūpaṃ
GR14vaimp__u:5013: 7.2.9.5 [5.5] tat satvo vā viṣṇur udyogas sūryo go vā viṣṇur viśat
GR14vaimp__u:5014: viśvaṃ viśvaṃ sandadhānas tad viśvaṃ viṣṇave viśva-rūpāya svāhā

GR14vaimp__u:5016: bhūr bhūr āsīd bhūr asi bhuvo 'si suvar asi bhūr bhūtaye svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:5017: 7.2.10.2 [5.7] āpo vā āpa āpo 'ntarātmā yo vedo vedānām ādhāraḥ

GR14vaimp__u:5024: kaṃ kaṃ pade pade pātaḥ pādāya pādite svāhā

GR14vaimp__u:5030: svayaṃ krīḍan krīḍayan krīḍāntaram anuprāviśat svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:5033: supuṇyaṃ puṇyātmakaṃ[*749] puṇya-vitānan dadhāra devāya svāhā

GR14vaimp__u:5043: 7.2.12.3 [6.8] prajā-pate na tvad etāny anyo viśvā jātāni pari tā babhūva

GR14vaimp__u:5046: 7.2.12.4 [6.9] yo dhūr dhuraṃ dhūr dhuraṃ dhūr varāṇām

GR14vaimp__u:5074: 7.2.14.4 [7.9] rayīṇāṃ patiṃ bṛhantaṃ rā-rāga-muktaṃ guruṃ sanīkam[*755]
GR14vaimp__u:5075: taṃ rāyo rūpaṃ rayi-bhūta-bhūtaṃ rayimat-sura-mitre[*756] svāhā

GR14vaimp__u:5082: 7.2.15.1 [8.1] yat sāra-bhūtaṃ sakalaṃ dharitraṃ moda-prāyeṇānubhūtam anuviddham

GR14vaimp__u:5086: 7.2.15.3 [8.3] dhūr no vahantāṃ rataye ramantāṃ puṃ-bhūtimantas samayas suṣumnā
GR14vaimp__u:5090: sa no vitatya prahiṇotu patre svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:5091: 7.2.15.5 [8.5] so vā sva-rūpas samadṛk samagro vidhu-daṃ tudan yo vidadhat padaṃ vā

GR14vaimp__u:5093: 7.2.16.1 [8.6] bhūr bhuvaṃ vā bhuvo vā suvo vā kiñcit svanantaṃ suṣuve samastam

GR14vaimp__u:5099: 7.2.16.4 [8.9] yo jaṃgamānāṃ sakalaṃ bibharṣi[*757] sarvaṃ viyad vā vicareta śakṣyan
GR14vaimp__u:5100: tan naur jale vapuṣy anty ajasra(gg)ṃ svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:5101: 7.2.16.5 [8.10] yo vā daśānāṃ prasṛtās samastās tāṃs tān dadhānās samayāt sa-bījāḥ

GR14vaimp__u:5111: 7.2.17.4 [9.4] viṣṇur variṣṭho vara-dāna-mukhyo yo viśva-ṛṣīn dhyāyan nu kurvan
GR14vaimp__u:5112: viśvaṃ hīṣad[*758] vyadadhat tam atra tad viṣṇave yāḥ prabhaviṣṇave yā amitaṃ bharatre svāhā
GR14vaimp__u:5113: 7.2.17.5 [9.5] abjo juṣantaḥ pravadat patantaḥ pūṃ pūṃ[*759] puṣantaḥ punar yaḥ pravālaḥ[*760]

GR14vaimp__u:5118: 7.2.18.1 [9.6] mām ātma-guptāṃ vahate sma bhūtyaitāṃ rājimantāṃ sudhūr dhūrayantīm

GR14vaimp__u:5122: 7.2.18.3 [9.8] puṇyāṃ ca puṇyaḥ puruṣe pur-agre tāṃ rājimantāṃ niśi coditānām
GR14vaimp__u:5124: 7.2.18.4 [9.9] so no bhūto yo vāmṛtātmā supuṣṭim asmat pitaraṃ pavitram
GR14vaimp__u:5126: 7.2.18.5 [9.10] sa tv eva nityaṃ sakalās sa-mūrtayas sa-ratās tv anantāḥ

GR14vaimp__u:7283: [*917] Verses 8.1.176.4-7 correspond to verses 4.2.1-4 of the Ṛg Veda Khila,
GR14vaimp__u:7284: the “Rātrī Khila“. Verses 8.1.176.4-5 also correspond to AV 19.47.1 and 19.47.3 respectively. In Coburn's Devi Māhātmya,
GR14vaimp__u:7286: he says that the sole variant between RVKh and AV is the AV's reading of draṣṭāro for yuktāso. However in Whitney's Atharva Veda Saṃhitā,
GR14vaimp__u:7289: he indicates another variant is AV's reading of santi for santu.
